curam.util.persistence.validation.basic.validator

Interface BasicMoneyValidator


  • public interface BasicMoneyValidator
    Basic Validator methods for Money types.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(Money value, Money expected)
      Validates that the supplied Money value is equal to the other supplied Money value.
      boolean isNegative(Money value)
      Validates that the supplied Money value is negative Note that passing a null value to the parameter causes validation to fail.
      boolean isPositive(Money value)
      Validates that the supplied Money value is positive Note that passing a null value to the parameter causes validation to fail.
      boolean isZero(Money value)
      Validates that the supplied Money value is zero.
      boolean maximumExclusive(Money value, Money maximumValue)
      Validates that the supplied Money value is strictly less than the supplied maximum Money value.
      boolean maximumInclusive(Money value, Money maximumValue)
      Validates that the supplied Money value is less than or equal to the supplied maximum Money value.
      boolean minimumExclusive(Money value, Money minimumValue)
      Validates that the supplied Money value is strictly greater than the supplied minimum Money value.
      boolean minimumInclusive(Money value, Money minimumValue)
      Validates that the supplied Money value is greater than or equal to the supplied minimum Money value.
      boolean notEquals(Money value, Money other)
      Validates that the supplied Money value is not equal to the other supplied Money value.
      boolean withinExclusive(Money value, Money minimumValue, Money maximumValue)
      Validates that the supplied Money value falls within the supplied bounds, excluding the bounds values.
      boolean withinInclusive(Money value, Money minimumValue, Money maximumValue)
      Validates that the supplied Money value falls within the supplied bounds, inclusive of the bounds values.

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        boolean equals(Money value,
               Money expected)
        Validates that the supplied Money value is equal to the other supplied Money value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to check.
        expected - The expected value.
        Returns:
        True if the validation is successful, false if it is unsuccessful.

      • isNegative

        boolean isNegative(Money value)
        Validates that the supplied Money value is negative

        Note that passing a null value to the parameter causes validation to fail.

        Parameters:
        value - The Money value to check.
        Returns:
        True if the validation is successful, false if it is unsuccessful.

        Returns:
        True if the validation is successful, false if it is unsuccessful.

        Returns:
        True if the validation is successful, false if it is unsuccessful.

      • maximumExclusive

        boolean maximumExclusive(Money value,
                         Money maximumValue)
        Validates that the supplied Money value is strictly less than the supplied maximum Money value.

        Note that passing a null value to any of the parameters causes validation to fail.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to check.
        maximumValue - The maximum value.
        Returns:
        True if the validation is successful, false if it is unsuccessful.

        Parameters:

        maximumValue - The maximum value.
        Returns:
        True if the validation is successful, false if it is unsuccessful.

        boolean notEquals(Money value,
                  Money other)
        Validates that the supplied Money value is not equal to the other supplied Money value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to check.
        other - The other value - that is, the value to which is not expected to be equal to the supplied value.
        Returns:
        Tue if the validation is successful, false if it is unsuccessful.

      • withinExclusive

        boolean withinExclusive(Money value,
                        Money minimumValue,
                        Money maximumValue)
        Validates that the supplied Money value falls within the supplied bounds, excluding the bounds values.

        Note that passing a null value to any of the parameters causes validation to fail.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to check.
        minimumValue - The minimum value.
        maximumValue - The maximum value.
        Returns:
        True if the validation is successful, false if it is unsuccessful.

      • withinInclusive

        boolean withinInclusive(Money value,
                        Money minimumValue,
                        Money maximumValue)
        Validates that the supplied Money value falls within the supplied bounds, inclusive of the bounds values.

        Note that passing a null value to any of the parameters causes validation to fail.

        Parameters:
        value - the value to check.
        minimumValue - The minimum value.
        maximumValue - The maximum value.
        Returns:
        True if the validation is successful, false if it is unsuccessful.
